The table shows the number of fires (in thousands) and acres burned (in millions) for federal, nonfederal, and total fires from 2018 to 2022. The data indicates fluctuations in the number of fires and acres burned over the years, with an overall increase in both categories from 2018 to 2022.

The table shows the number of structures burned in 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022, with a breakdown of the percentage of residences affected each year. The number of structures burned decreased significantly from 2020 to 2022, with the highest percentage of residences affected in 2021.
